subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Women in Islam: The Debate
description: A quick, practical guide to Women in Islam: The Debate.

hook.text: The Quran gave women inheritance rights 1,300 years before Europe did. Yet many Muslim women face oppression. Why?

buildup.text: Early Islam was revolutionary for women. Khadijah was a businesswoman; Aisha was a scholar and military advisor.

discovery.text: The Quran grants women property, divorce, and education rights. Many restrictions attributed to Islam are cultural.

twist.text: Muslim feminists argue patriarchy hijacked Islam. They use the Quran itself to fight for women's equality.

climax.text: The debate over women in Islam is about who interprets scripture: reformers or traditionalists. The text is contested.

punchline.text: Islam gave women rights early. Culture took many back. Reformers fight on.

quiz.question: What rights does the Quran grant women?
